title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 132.3 - Items attributable to real or tangible personal property in New York State
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 132.3 - Items attributable to real or tangible personal property in New York State

State Regulations

Tax Law, ยง 632(b)(1)(A)
(a) The New York adjusted gross income of a
nonresident individual includes items of income, gain, loss and deduction
entering into his Federal adjusted gross income which are attributable to the
ownership of any interest in real or tangible personal property in New York

State. Thus, New York adjusted gross income includes rental income from real or
tangible personal property in New York State or any interest therein after
deducting ordinary and necessary expenses attributable to the ownership, operation or maintenance of such property. (b) The New York adjusted gross income of a
nonresident individual does not include items of income, gain, loss and
deduction attributable to the ownership of any interest in real or tangible
personal property located outside New York State, even though rental payments
in respect of the property may be made from a point within New York

State. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
ยง
132.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
